comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: David H. Slade was a New Haven attorney indicted in 1915 (with his brother Maxwell Slade) on a charge of conspiracy to obstruct justice.  Best I can tell....Slade and Slade represented Rae Tanzer, in a seduction/breach of promise suit against a man named James W. Osborne (also a lawyer).  Turned out that Osborne wasn't the man she said he was.  Then Tanzer was arrested for perjury, and using the mails with intent to defraud, with related conspiracy charges that included the Slades and Tanzer's two sisters (Dora and Rose), and a hotel clerk, Frank Safford, and a detective named McCullough.

comment.author: 33557226@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/11418107@N02] Thanks so much for the info.

comment._content: David H. Slade was my grandfather...this is amazing!
